question.content: Which among the following is a part of the URL (Uniform Resource Locator)? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024

solution.content: Port Number. Parts of URL: scheme, sub- domain, domain, top level domain, port number, path, query, parameters, fragment. A server is a computer or system that provides resources, data, services, or programs to other computers, known as clients, over a network. A multiplexer is a device that selects one of several input signals and forwards it to a single output.

question.content: What is the purpose of the 'Alignment' options in Microsoft Word? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024

options.text: To adjust the spacing between lines of text.
To change the font colour of the text.
To control the horizontal or vertical placement of text within margins.

answer: To control the horizontal or vertical placement of text within margins.

solution.content: Alignment is how text flows in relation to the rest of the page (or column, table cell, text box, etc.). There are four main alignments: left (Ctrl + L), right (Ctrl + R), center (Ctrl + E), and justify (Ctrl + J).

question.content: What is the role of ROM (Read-Only Memory) in a computer system? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024

options.text: Storing the computer's firmware and startup instructions.
Providing temporary storage for running applications.

answer: Storing the computer's firmware and startup instructions.

solution.content: ROM (read only memory), is a memory device or storage medium that stores information permanently. Types: Mask ROM Permanently programmed during the manufacturing process. Cannot be altered by the user. Programmable ROM (PROM) Can be programmed once using special equipment and a one-time programming voltage. Cannot be erased or reprogrammed. Erasable and Programmable ROM (EPROM): Can be erased using ultraviolet light and then reprogrammed multiple times. Electrically Erasable Programmable ROM (EEPROM): Can be erased and reprogrammed electrically within the device, offering greater flexibility than EPROM.

question.content: What is a 'DDoS attack' in the context of network security? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024

options.text: An attack that aims to exploit vulnerabilities in software
An attack that floods a network with excessive traffic to overwhelm and disrupt its operation.
A type of malware that replicates itself and spreads through a network.
A social engineering attack that targets specific individuals.

answer: An attack that floods a network with excessive traffic to overwhelm and disrupt its operation.

solution.content: Some of the severe emerging threats to network security are DDOS (distributed denial-of-service) attacks, man-in-the-middle attacks, phishing attacks, inadequate network protocols, and ransomware attacks.

question.content: What is 'Phishing' in the context of network security? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024

options.text: A type of computer worm that spreads through email attachments.
An attack that floods a network with excessive traffic to disrupt its operation.
A social engineering attack that tricks users into revealing sensitive information.
A type of malware that spreads through infected USB drives.

answer: A social engineering attack that tricks users into revealing sensitive information.

solution.content: Four types of phishing: Spear Phishing, Whaling, Vishing, Email Phishing. More types of cyber attacks: Malware (short for "malicious software") is a file or code, typically delivered over a network, that infects, explores, steals or conducts virtually any behavior an attacker wants. Spoofing is the act of disguising a communication from an unknown source as being from a known, trusted source.

question.content: What is a workbook in Excel? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024

options.text: A collection of cells with related data
A set of predefined formatting styles

solution.content: Terminologies in MS Excel: Cell Reference - The set of coordinates that a cell occupies on a worksheet. A Worksheet which is also called a spreadsheet is a combination of cells. Ribbon is the area where tabs and icons are arranged in rows in the upper portion of the worksheet. AutoFill is a feature in Excel that allows users to quickly fill in a series of cells with a pattern or data. Flash Fill allows users to quickly fill in a column of data based on another column of data.

question.content: What is the keyboard shortcut to 'Paste' copied content from the clipboard in most Windows applications? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024

solution.content: Ctrl + V. Ctrl + C- It is used to copy selected text or images to clipboard. Ctrl + Z - It is used to undo an action. Ctrl +X - It is used to cut selected text or files from a document or folder.

question.content: What is the main purpose of the 'BCC' field in email composition? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024

options.text: To include multiple main recipients in a single field.
To indicate the importance of the email.
To send copies of the email without revealing the other recipients' addresses.
To attach files to the email.

answer: To send copies of the email without revealing the other recipients' addresses.

solution.content: Email terminologies: An attachment is any type of file sent along with an email message. Base64 is a method of encoding and decoding. The "To" line is for the primary recipient. CC (carbon copy), allowing someone apart from the primary recipient to receive a copy of the email.

question.content: What protocol is commonly used for sending and receiving emails? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024

solution.content: The Secure Shell (SSH) protocol is a method for securely sending commands to a computer over an unsecured network. FTP is a standard internet protocol provided by TCP/IP used for transmitting the files from one host to another. Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) is an application-level protocol for distributed, collaborative, hypermedia information systems.

question.content: Which of the following is an example of an output device? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024

solution.content: Printer. Examples of Output devices Monitor, Headphones, Computer Speakers, Projector, GPS, Sound Card, Video Card. Input Devices: Keyboard, Mouse, Light Pen, Optical /magnetic Scanner, Touch Screen, Microphone for voice as input, Track Ball, Joystick.

question.content: What is the purpose of the Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU) in a Central Processing Unit (CPU)? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024

options.text: It executes program instructions by performing calculations and logical comparisons.
It manages the data flow between the CPU fan.
It controls the speed of the CPU fan.
It connects the CPU to peripheral devices.

answer: It executes program instructions by performing calculations and logical comparisons.

solution.content: Logical operations: comparisons (greater than, less than, equal to), AND, OR, NOT. The primary function of an ALU is to store and retrieve data from memory. There can be more than one ALU in a CPU.

question.content: How can you open an existing document in Microsoft Word 2016? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024

solution.content: Ctrl + O. Shortcuts: Ctrl + N- Create a new document, Ctrl + S Save the document, Ctrl + W Close the document.

question.content: Which keyboard shortcut opens File Explorer (previously known as Windows Explorer) in Windows 10? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024

solution.content: Win + E. File explorer shortcuts in Windows 11: Alt + D: Select the address bar. Ctrl + E: Select the search box. Ctrl + N: Open a new window. Num Lock + asterisk (*): Display all subfolders under the selected folder. Num Lock + plus (+): Display the contents of the selected folder. Num Lock + minus (-): Collapse the selected folder.

question.content: What is the purpose of a search engine on the internet? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024

options.text: To create and edit documents online.
To search and retrieve relevant information from the web.
To network with people on social media platforms.

answer: To search and retrieve relevant information from the web.

solution.content: The search engine looks at user queries to establish searcher intent, which is the specific type of information the user is looking for. Examples: Google, Bing, Yahoo, Yandex, DuckDuckGo, Baidu, Ask.com, Naver.

question.content: Which networking protocol is used to assign IP addresses dynamically to devices on a network? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024

solution.content: DHCP. It is a network protocol that is used to configure network devices to communicate on an IP network. An Internet Protocol (IP) address is the unique identifying number assigned to every device connected to the internet. IP (version 4) addresses are 32-bit integers that can be expressed in hexadecimal notation. An IPv6 address is 128 bits long compared with the 32 bit address of IPv4.

question.content: The CPU interacts directly with the _ memory to perform read or write operation. SSC CHSL Tier II 02/11/2023

solution.content: Primary Memory. Types: Random Access Memory (RAM), Read Only Memory (ROM). Secondary Memory : Solid State Drive (SSD), Hard Disk, Blu-ray Disc, Compact Disc (CD), Digital Versatile Disc (DVD), Optical Disc, Magnetic Tapes, Floppy Disc.

question.content: In MS-Excel 365, the_ between two columns is an indicator that we have hidden a column. SSC CHSL Tier II 02/11/2023

solution.content: Double line. In MS Excel 365, Single arrows are used to expand or collapse groups of rows or columns. Double arrows are used to filter data in a column. Single line are the standard dividers between visible columns.

question.content: In MS-Excel 365, you can use when you want to change a cell reference within a formula without changing the formula itself. SSC CHSL Tier II 02/11/2023

solution.content: INDIRECT. Other functions: VLOOKUP Looks for a value in the leftmost column of a table, and then returns a value in the same row from the column we specify. TRANSPOSE Converts a vertical range of cells to а horizontal range, or vice versa. MATCH - Returns the relative position of an item in an array that matches a specified value in a specified order.

question.content: In computer memory bus is used to transfer addresses between CPU and the main memory. SSC CHSL Tier II 02/11/2023

solution.content: address bus. A computer bus is a set of conductors that enable information to be transmitted between computer components, such as printers, modems, and monitors. A data bus transfers data between a computer's memory and its CPU, which operates as the device's "engine". The control bus manages the communication between the computer's CPU and its other components.

question.content: A bit is an extra bit included with a binary message to make the total number of 1s either odd or even. SSC CHSL Tier II 02/11/2023

solution.content: parity bit. A parity bit is a simple form of error detection used in digital communications, computing, and data storage.

question.content: In computer memory, the width of the _bus specifies the maximum possible memory supported by a system. SSC CHSL Tier II 02/11/2023

solution.content: address bus. The primary function of an address bus is to specify the unique address of the location in cache or main memory intended for reading or writing. Each distinct memory location possesses its own exclusive address, a concept referred to as addressability. I/O (input output) bus: Connects the CPU to input/output devices like keyboards, mice, and printers.

question.content: Which of the following parts of given URL is a 'domain name'? http://www.india.in/tallybook/tallybook.x yz SSC CHSL Tier II 02/11/2023

solution.content: www.india.in. A URL (Uniform Resource Locator) is a unique identifier used to locate a resource on the Internet. http: This is the protocol used for communication, in this case, indicating Hypertext Transfer Protocol. /tallybook/: This specifies the directory or folder within the website where the desired content is located. tallybook.xyz: This is the filename of the specific resource, possibly an HTML file or another web asset, within the /tallybook/ directory.

question.content: Which of the following types of firewall operates at the Network layer to examine incoming and outgoing packets? SSC CHSL Tier II 02/11/2023

solution.content: packet filtering. It is a powerful security technique against intrusions from external networks. An application-level gateway (ALG) is a type of firewall that filters traffic at the application layer of the OSI (open systems interconnection) model. A circuit-level gateway is a type of firewall that operates on layer 5 of the OSI model, which is the session layer. Proxy firewalls operate at the application layer as an intermediate device to filter incoming traffic between two end systems (e.g., network and traffic systems).

question.content: In email, which of the following mode(s) is/are included in the Post Office Protocol (POP)? I. Delete Mode II. Keep Mode SSC CHSL Tier II 02/11/2023

solution.content: The Post Office Protocol (POP) service is a network server by which client-based email programs are connected to access a user's email on a central server. Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port 110.

question.content: Which of the following statements is/are correct for email? 1. A user can check the email header prior to downloading. II. A user can partially download an email. SSC CHSL Tier II 02/11/2023

solution.content: Both I and II. Different Parts of Email: Sender/from, subject line, pre-header, salutation, email body, Closing line, Signature, Call to Action (CTA), Attachments. A call to action (CTA), if defined, is an instruction to the reader that encourages them to take immediate action.

question.content: In MS Office 365, the 'Table of Authorities' group can be found under which of the following tabs? SSC CHSL Tier II 02/11/2023

solution.content: References tab (Table of contents, footnotes). Review Tab (Proofing, word count, accessibility, translate, comments, tracking, mark up). Layout tab (Page setup, page background, paragraph). Insert (pages, tables, picture, illustrations, links, bookmarks, media, comments, header and footer, symbols, emojis).

question.content: In File Explorer of Windows 11, to reduce the space between files, select view > view. SSC CHSL Tier II 02/11/2023

solution.content: Compact. In Windows 11 under View menu (Tiles, content, details pane, preview pane, show). Under Show menu (Navigation pane, compact view, item check boxes, file name extensions, hidden items).

question.content: Which of the following keyboard shortcuts is used to copy the selected item in Windows 11? SSC CHSL Tier II 02/11/2023

solution.content: Ctrl + Insert. Shift + Insert: Paste selected or highlighted item. Ctrl + Enter is the keyboard shortcut in MS-Word that starts a new page. In Excel, Ctrl + Enter fills the selected cells with the current entry. Shift-Enter allows us to go to the next line without creating a new bullet or number in MS Word.

question.content: A is a program that can self-replicate and propagate over the network. SSC CHSL Tier II 02/11/2023

solution.content: Worm. A boot sector virus is a type of malware that infects a system's boot partition or the Master Boot Record (MBR) of a hard disk. A macro virus is a computer virus written in the same macro language used to create software programs such as Microsoft Excel or Word.

question.content: A/An is an organisation that connects its subscriber's computer using modem to the Internet. SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

solution.content: Internet Service Provider (ISP). Examples of ISP: Airtel, Jio, Alliance, YOU, BSNL, Hathway, Tata Play, Exitel etc.

question.content: Which of the following is an example of GUI-based user in email? SSC CGL Tier I| 26/10/2023

solution.content: Netscape, outlook & Eudora (examples of GUI-based user in email). GUI- Based- They contain graphical-user interface (GUI) components that allow the user to interact with the software by using both the keyboard and the mouse. Some examples of command-driven user agents are mail, pine, and elm. ELM is a simple mailer program that allows us to send and receive email. Pine is a "mail user agent" (MUA), which is a program that allows you to compose and read messages using Internet mail standards.

question.content: In MS Office 365, the Page Setup dialog box can be found under which of the following tabs? SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

solution.content: Layout. Menus under Layout tab- Page setup (Margins, Orientation, Size), Paragraph (Indent, Spacing), Page Background (Page Colour). Home tab- Clipboard, font, paragraph, styles. Insert (Page Break, table, picture, drawing, link, bookmarks, header & footers, page numbers, equation, symbol).

question.content: When the sender and receiver of an email are on the same system, we need only user agents. SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

solution.content: two. When the sender and the receiver of an e-mail are on different systems, we need two UAs (User Agents) and a pair of MTAs (client and server). MTAs- Message transfer agents. When the sender is connected to the mail server via a LAN (Local Area Network) or a WAN (Wide Area Network), we need two UAs and two pairs of MTAs (client and server). When both sender and receiver are connected to the mail server via a LAN or a WAN, we need two UAs. two pairs of MTAS and a pair of MAA (Message Access Agent).

question.content: In File Explorer of Windows 11, which of the following tabs includes the 'hidden items' option? SSC CGL Tier |I 26/10/2023

solution.content: View tab. Menus under view tab in file explorer - Tiles, Content, Details Pane, Preview Pane, Show. In the Show menu we will find Navigation Pane, Compact View, item check boxes, file name, extensions, hidden items. Menu under Filter tab (All file types, Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Images, Videos and PDF).

question.content: What is the primary purpose of RAM (Random Access Memory) in a computer? SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

options.text: Providing temporary storage for data that the CPU is currently processing

answer: Providing temporary storage for data that the CPU is currently processing

solution.content: RAM is a computer or laptop's short-term memory. It's where the data is stored that the computer processor needs to run applications and open files. The information stored in RAM can be checked with the help of BIOS (Basic Input/ Output System). BIOS is the program a computer's microprocessor uses to start the computer system after it is powered on. RAM is volatile in nature, which means the data is lost when the device is switched off.

question.content: What is a cell in Microsoft Excel? SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

options.text: A separate file used to store data.
A single worksheet within a workbook.
The intersection of a row and a column in a worksheet.

answer: The intersection of a row and a column in a worksheet.

solution.content: Cells are the basic building blocks of a worksheet. A worksheet (also known as a spreadsheet) consists of cells in which we can enter and calculate data. The active cell is the selected cell in which data is entered when we begin typing. A range is a group of two or more cells in a worksheet.

question.content: Which networking device operates at Layer 2 of the OSI model and forwards data based on MAC addresses? SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

solution.content: Switch. A network switch connects devices in a network to each other, enabling them to talk by exchanging data packets. A hub is a device that links multiple computers and devices together. A router is a device that connects two or more packet-switched networks.

question.content: Which backup device provides a convenient way to create system images and complete backups, but may require a lengthy restoration process? SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

solution.content: A tape drive is a device that stores computer data on magnetic tape, especially for backup and archiving purposes. DVD Rewritable (DVD RW) discs are designed to store up to 4.7GB or 120 minutes of DVD-quality video.

question.content: In MS-Excel 2019, what does the SUM function do? SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

options.text: It adds up the values in a range.
It counts the number of cells in a range.
It finds the average of values in a range.

answer: It adds up the values in a range.

solution.content: The SUM function adds values. We can add individual values, cell references or ranges or a mix of all three. For example: =SUM (A3:A10) adds the values in cells A3:10. SUMIF (range, criteria, [sum_range]) Adds the cell specified by a given condition or criteria.

question.content: Which of the following is not an example of a web browser? SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

solution.content: Facebook (social networking site). Examples of social networking sites: Twitter, Instagram, Linkedin, Snapchat, Google meet. A web browser is an application for accessing websites and the Internet. Examples: Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, Opera, Safari, Microsoft Edge, Netscape Navigator, Mosaic.

question.content: What is the function of the cache memory in a computer's memory hierarchy? SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

options.text: To provide permanent storage for data and files.
To store frequently used data for faster access by the CPU.
To control the flow of data between the CPU and memory.
To manage the allocation of memory resources to different programs.

answer: To store frequently used data for faster access by the CPU.

solution.content: Cache memory is a chip-based computer component that makes retrieving data from the computer's memory more efficient. It is an extremely fast memory type that acts as a buffer between RAM and the CPU. It holds frequently requested data and instructions so that they are immediately available to the CPU when needed. It is costlier than main memory or disk memory but more economical than CPU registers.

question.content: What is a 'Firewall' in the context of network security? SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

options.text: A software application for managing files and folders.
A type of malware that spreads through email attachments.
A security mechanism that filters and controls network traffic.
A hardware device used to boost network performance.

answer: A security mechanism that filters and controls network traffic.

solution.content: A firewall is defined as the system which analyzes and filters incoming or outgoing data packets based on predefined rules. Because the firewall supports both types of implementations, hardware, and software, therefore, it is more scalable (adaptable) than anti-virus. Functions: Network Threat Prevention, Application and Identity-Based Control, Hybrid Cloud Support, Network Traffic Management and Control, Access Validation Record and Report on Events.

question.content: A high speed memory is placed between the Central Processing Unit (CPU) and the primary memory known as SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

solution.content: Cache memory is a very high speed semiconductor memory which can speed up the CPU.

question.content: In computer registers, MAR stands for SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

solution.content: MAR (Memory Address Registers). It holds the address of the location to be accessed from memory. MAR and MDR (Memory Data Register) together facilitate the communication of the CPU and the main memory. Memory Data Registers: It contains data to be written into or to be read out from the addressed location. More types of registers: AC (accumulator), DR (Data registers), PC (Program counter), IR (index registers), MBR (Memory buffer registers).

question.content: What is a 'Trojan' in the context of network security? SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

options.text: A protocol used for secure communication between devices on a network.
A program that monitors network traffic for security breaches.
A type of firewall that protects against viruses and malware.
Malicious software disguised as legitimate software to gain unauthorised access.

answer: Malicious software disguised as legitimate software to gain unauthorised access.

solution.content: A Trojan virus spreads through legitimate-looking emails and files attached to emails, which are spammed to reach the inboxes of as many people as possible.

question.content: In Microsoft Word, what is the purpose of the 'Print Preview' feature? SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

options.text: To insert images and graphics into the document.
To format the font and style of the document.
To check the spelling and grammar of the document.
To view how the document will appear when printed.

answer: To view how the document will appear when printed.

solution.content: Print Preview (Ctrl + F2, Ctrl + P). The Print menu is present in the File tab of MS Word. Some important features of MS Word: Word Wrap: This function allows us to type continuously without thinking about where one line will end and next one begins. Spell Check: Spell check under 'tools' menu is used to check the spelling mistakes occurred in the document. Mail Merge: Mail merge lets us create a batch of documents that are personalized for each recipient.

question.content: In File Explorer of Window 10, the keyboard shortcut 'Num Lock + Asterisk sign (*)' is used to SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

options.text: display all subfolders under the selected folder
open the properties dialog box for the selected item
display the contents of the selected folder

answer: display all subfolders under the selected folder

solution.content: File explorer keyboard shortcuts: Num Lock + plus (+): Display the contents of the selected folder. Num Lock + minus (): Collapse the selected folder. Ctrl + Shift + E: Display all folders above the selected folder. Ctrl + Shift + N: Create a new folder.

question.content: Which of the following is an example of the input device in a computer? SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023

solution.content: Touchscreen. Examples of input devices: Keyboard, Mouse, Scanner, Microphone, web cam, Magnetic Ink Character Reader (MICR), Gamepad, Touchpad, Digital Pen, Joystick, Barcode reader.

question.content: Which of the following is a communication mail channel in India ?

solution.content: Green Channel A mail from a town posted to the same town is delivered the next day through the green channel in metropolitan cities. It is the fastest local mail service available for postal services in the city. Indian Postal Service has introduced six channels To facilitate faster communication (personal) Rajdhani Channel, Metro Channel, Green Channel, Business Channel, Bulk Channel, and Periodical Channel.

question.content: In Windows 10, which of the following keyboard shortcuts is used to display and hide the desktop? SSC CHSL Tier - 2 26/06/2023

solution.content: Windows logo key + D. Windows logo key + G - It is used to open Xbox Game Bar when a game is open. Windows logo key + C - It is used to open chat from Microsoft Teams. Windows logo key + H- It is used to Launch voice typing.

question.content: Which of the following is NOT a part of an email address? SSC CHSL Tier - 2 26/06/2023

solution.content: Photo. Parts of an email address are : Username- The username is the name we choose to be identified with for e-mail purposes and that we have provided to the email host to create our email account. '@' symbol- @ (pronounced "at the rate of") is the symbol in an Email address that separates the name of the user from the user's Internet address. Mail Server- A mail server transfers and delivers email messages between two or more mail clients. Domain A domain name forms part of the Uniform Resource Locator (URL) and is the address for a webpage. Example:- ssccglpinnacle@gmail.com.

question.content: Identify whether the following statements are true or false with reference to MS-Word 2010. (i) A template can be selected while creating a new document. (ii) The keyboard shortcut for going to the end of a document is Shift + End. SSC CHSL Tier - 2 26/06/2023

solution.content: (i) True (ii) False. In Microsoft Word, templates are pre -designed documents. The template could be for a business card, brochure, resume, presentation.

question.content: Which of the following types of hackers, also known as crackers, hack to gain unauthorised access to a system and harm its operations or steal sensitive information? SSC CHSL Tier - 2 26/06/2023

solution.content: Black Hat. A white hat (ethical hacker) is an individual who uses hacking skills to identify security vulnerabilities in hardware, software or networks. A red hat is a hacker who takes aggressive steps to stop black hat hackers. A gray hat is a computer security expert who sometimes violates ethical standards but doesn't have malicious intentions.

question.content: Which of the following is a mini-DIN connector used to connect a keyboard and mouse to a PC compatible computer? SSC CHSL Tier - 2 26/06/2023

solution.content: PS/2 port:- The PS/2 port is a 6-pin mini-DIN connector used for connecting keyboards and mice to a PC compatible computer system. It is also called a mouse port.

question.content: What is the diameter of a Blu-ray Disc? SSC CHSL Tier - 2 26/06/2023

solution.content: 120 mm. Blu-ray Disc is 120 mm in diameter and 1.2 mm thick, the same size as DVDs (digital versatile/video disks) and CDs (Compact disks). Currently, 50GB and 25GB capacity, Blu-ray Disc media is available in both the BD-RE rewritable and BD-R recordable formats.

question.content: The_ unit is that part of the CPU which controls or directs the operations of the processor. SSC CHSL Tier - 2 26/06/2023

solution.content: Control. A control unit handles all processor control signals. The control unit is made up of flip-flops, logic gates, digital circuits and encoder and decoder circuits that are wired in a specific and fixed way.

question.content: A _ is an electronic device that receives a weak signal and regenerates it.

solution.content: Repeater operates at the physical layer. It is a powerful network hardware device that regenerates an incoming signal from the sender before retransmitting it to the receiver.

question.content: Which of the following shortcut keys is used to make the contents of a cell underlined in MS-Excel 365?

solution.content: Ctrl + 4. Some other shortcut key in MS-Excel 365: Ctrl + 0- To hide the selected column, Ctrl + 1 - Open the Format Cells dialog box, Ctrl + 2 - Bold text or remove bold formatting, Ctrl + 3 Italicize text or remove italic formatting, Ctrl + 5 Apply or remove strikethrough formatting, Ctrl+6 Hides and shows hidden objects, Ctrl + 8 Display and hide the outline symbols, Ctrl +9-To hide a row.

question.content: In a star network, how many lines are required for connecting N nodes to the host node?

solution.content: N-1. Network topology Arrangement of a network, comprising nodes and connecting lines. There are 6 types of topology, Bus Topology - Every computer is connected to a common bus (single cable), Ring Topology Every node is connected to two other nodes, forming a loop. Tree Topology - A central root node from which all other nodes branch out, Star Topology Each device on the network is connected to a central hub, Mesh Topology ({n(n-1)/2})- Each node is connected to every other node in the network, Hybrid Topology It is a combination of two or more network topologies.

question.content: Which of the following shortcut keys is used to move the cursor one word to the left in MS-Word 365?

solution.content: Ctrl + Left arrow key. Ctrl + Page Up Moves the cursor one Line Up. The Shift + left arrow and Shift + right arrow combinations moving the cursor to the beginning and the end of a line respectively.

question.content: Sam wants to share his presentation with larger audience via emails. Which feature of MS PowerPoint 365 can he use for it?

solution.content: Share. Features of Microsoft Powerpoint 365 Designer, Smart Lookup, QuickStarter, New charts, Morphing, Real-time collab, Version History, Zoom for non-sequential presentations. Short keys (Close PowerPoint - Ctrl + Q, Add a new slide Ctrl + M, Insert a hyperlink - Ctrl + K, Open a presentation - Ctrl + O, italic formatting - Ctrl + I, Save As Ctrl + S).

question.content: Natural language processing (NLP) is a branch of artificial intelligence that helps computers human language. I. understand II. Interpret III. manipulate

solution.content: 1, II and III. Natural Language Processing (NLP) refers to the branch of Artificial Intelligence that gives the machines the ability to read, understand and derive meaning from human languages.

question.content: Which of the following is NOT an application software?

solution.content: Programming language translator software. Software is a set of instructions. Softwares are majorly classified into two categories: System Software and Application Software. System software is a type of computer program that is designed to run a computer's hardware and application programs. Example - operating systems (OS) (Fedora, Ubuntu, Unix, Linux, Android and Microsoft Windows).

question.content: Sheetal wants to create financial statements for her business. Which among the following software should she use for the same?

solution.content: Spreadsheet software. It helps a user perform numerical functions and analyze numbers through a computerized version of an accounting worksheet. An Example - Excel.

question.content: IBM 360 was developed in which of the following generations of computer?

solution.content: Third generation. First Generation (1940 - 56): Vacuum tubes were used. Example: ENIAC (Electronic Numerical Integrator And Computer), EDVAC (Electronic Discrete Variable Automatic Computer), EDSAC (Electronic Delay Storage Automatic Calculator), UNIVAC I (Universal Automatic Computer 1), IBM 701, IBM 650 etc.

question.content: Which of the following shortcut keys is used to add a new blank slide to an existing presentation of MS -PowerPoint 365?

solution.content: Ctrl + M. question.content: In which of the following modes of data transmission, can the data flow in both directions simultaneously?

solution.content: Full - duplex (Example:- Telephone). Data Transmission - sending digital or analog data over a communication medium to one or more computing, network, communication or electronic devices. Types: Simplex Mode the communication between sender and receiver occurs in only one direction. Example Keyboard and Traditional Monitors. Half duplex both parties can communicate with each other, but not simultaneously. Example- Walkie- Talkie.

It is used for storing data.

question.content: 1 terabytes per second bytes per second

solution.content: 240. 1 kilobyte (KB) - 1024 byte 210 bytes .1 Megabyte (MB) - 1024 KB - 220 bytes.1 Gigabyte (GB) - 1024 MB 230 bytes .1 Petabyte (PB) 1024 TB - 250 bytes. 1 Exabyte (EB) - 1024 PB - 260 bytes. 1 Zettabyte (ZB) 1024 EB- 270 bytes. 1 Yottabyte (YB) - 1024 ZB - 280 bytes. 1 Brontobyte - 1024 YB - 290 bytes 1 Geopbyte - 1024 Brontobyte- 2100 bytes.

solution.content: Only P and Q. The MATCH function is used to determine the position of a value in a range or array. MATCH only supports one-dimensional arrays or ranges, either vertical or horizontal.

question.content: Which among the following statements is incorrect about Central Processing Unit? SSC CGL Tier II 06/03/2023

options.text: Control Unit controls the order in which instructions enter and leave the processor and how the instructions are executed.
Arithmetic Logic Unit is responsible for taking the input, converting it into a signal, and storing it for further processing.
Arithmetic Logic Unit is also known as the mathematical brain of a computer.
Control Unit directs and manages operation sequences.

answer: Arithmetic Logic Unit is responsible for taking the input, converting it into a signal, and storing it for further processing.

solution.content: Arithmetic - logic unit is the part of a central processing unit that carries out arithmetic and logic operations on the operands in computer instruction words. In some processors, the ALU is divided into two units: an arithmetic unit (AU) and a logic unit (LU). Control Unit coordinates the flow of data out of, into, and between the various subunits of a processor.

question.content: Which among the following registers in Instruction Cycle holds the last instruction fetched? SSC CGL Tier I| 06/03/2023

solution.content: Instruction Register (IR). Program Counter (PC) holds the address of the next instruction to be fetched. Memory buffer register (MBR) or memory data register (MDR) is the register in a computer's CPU that stores the data being transferred to and from the immediate access storage. Memory address registers (MAR) are connected to the address lines of the system bus.

solution.content: 1. The MATCH function searches for a specified item in a range of cells and then returns the relative position of that item in the range. Syntax {MATCH(lookup_value, lookup_array, [match_type])}.

question.content: Which of the following is an extension of a temporary file?

solution.content: .tmp. The full form of JPG or JPEG is Joint Photographic Expert Group. PDF stands for Portable Document Format.

question.content: Which of the following is NOT an open-source operating system?

solution.content: Windows. An Open-source Operating System is the Operating System in which source code is visible publicly and editable. The generally known Operating Systems like Microsoft's Windows, Apple's iOS, and Mac OS, are closed Operating systems.

question.content: What do you call an event where a computer becomes unresponsive due to either a program or the system itself becoming unresponsive and no longer taking input?

solution.content: Hanging. Booting is the process of starting a computer. Eject removes the media from the device (e.g., ejects the CD tray) but doesn't remove the device itself.

question.content: A is an ordered list in which all insertions and deletions are made at one end.

solution.content: stack. Queue: the name of the array storing queue elements. Front: the index where the first element is stored in the array representing the queue. Rear: the index where the last element is stored in an array representing the queue.

question.content: A message that tries to trick a person into providing information such as his social security number, bank account information or login username and password for a website is a type of malware called:

solution.content: Phishing.

question.content: Which of the following languages is an example of a fourth-generation language in computer programming?

solution.content: SQL. The fourth-generation language is also called a non-procedural language/ 4GL. It enables users to access the database. Examples: SQL, Foxpro, Focus, etc. Many fourth-generation languages use Structured Query Language (SQL) as the basis for operations. SQL was developed at IBM to develop information stored in relational databases.

question.content: Chad Hurley and Steve Chen are computer innovators credited with co-founding _

solution.content: YouTube. Steve Chen, Chad Hurley, and Jawed Karim launched You Tube in February 2005 and In October 2006, at a later time, YouTube was bought by Google for $1.65 billion.

question.content: In which year was Microsoft's Windows operating system first introduced?

solution.content: 1985 Microsoft introduced an operating environment named Windows on November 20, 1985, as a graphical operating system shell for MS-DOS in response to the growing interest in graphical user interfaces (GUIS).

question.content: Which of the following is the core of an operating system?

solution.content: Kernel is a computer program at the core of a computer's operating system and has complete control over everything in the system. It is the "portion of the operating system code that is always resident in memory", and facilitates interactions between hardware and software components.

question.content: What kind of file has the extension.png?

solution.content: Image file. A PNG file is an and invented and established image saved in the Portable Network Graphic (PNG) format. It is the most frequently used uncompressed raster image format on the internet, having the ability to display transparent backgrounds.

question.content: In which year was the first-ever version of Microsoft Word - Word 1.0 launched?

solution.content: 1983. Microsoft Word is a word-processor software launched by the Microsoft Corporation. Word 1.0 was the first Word version of Microsoft Word. It was released for Xenix and MS-DOS in October 1983. Microsoft Word was developed by Richard Brodie and Charles Simonyi.

question.content: Which of the following operating systems guarantees a response within specified time constraints?

solution.content: с) Real-time operating systems are used in environments where a large number of events, mostly external to the computer system, must be accepted and processed in a short time within certain deadlines.

question.content: GIMP is a/an

solution.content: Application software. GIMP stands for "GNU Image Manipulation Program", a self-explanatory name for an application that processes digital graphics.

question.content: The first barcode system was developed by:

solution.content: , Norman Joseph Woodland (In 1952). John McCarthy, coined the term "Artificial Intelligence," invented the first programming language for symbolic computation, LISP (which is still used as a preferred language in the field of Al), time-sharing.

question.content: A is a software program that travels the web locating and indexing websites for search engines.

solution.content: A spider is a program that visits Web sites and reads their pages and other information in order to create entries for a search engine index. Bug- It is an unexpected problem with software or hardware. Python - It is a high-level, general-purpose programming language.

question.content: Which of the following is the full form of ASCII?

options.text: American Standard Code for Information Interchange
Asian Standard Code for Information Interchange
Analytical Scientific Code for Information Interchange
Analytical Standard Code for Intermittent Information

answer: American Standard Code for Information Interchange

solution.content: American Standard Code for Information Interchange.

question.content: An/A is a finite set of instructions which. when followed. accomplish a particular task.

solution.content: An algorithm is a finite set of instructions that, when followed, accomplish a particular task. The algorithm is a finite sequence of well-defined, computer-implementable instructions, typically to solve a class of specific problems or to perform a computation.

question.content: A User Interface is the part of _ that allows the user to enter and receive information.

solution.content: A User Interface is the part of the operating system that allows the user to enter and receive information. Popular Operating Systems include Microsoft Windows, Mac OS X, and Linux.

question.content: What do you call a key on a computer keyboard that is used to move the pointer (cursor) around on the screen?

solution.content: A navigation key is a key on a computer keyboard that is used to move the pointer (cursor) around on the screen. They include the Four Arrow keys, PageUp, PageDown, Home and End keys.

question.content: Which of the following keyboard shortcuts will you press in order to minimise all programs on a computer screen and display the desktop?

solution.content: Windows + D should be pressed in order to minimize all programs on a computer screen and display the desktop.

question.content: CorelDraw is an example of a/an:

solution.content: desktop publishing software. Other examples of software: Spreadsheet software: Microsoft Excel, Apple Numbers, Google Sheets. Accounting software Sage Intacct, Desktop Pro, QuickBooks Online Advanced,Oracle ERP Cloud.

question.content: Which of the following is the full form of EBCDIC?

solution.content: Extended Binary-Coded-Dec mal Interchange Code (EBCDIC), data-encoding system, developed by IBM.

question.content: Which keyboard shortcut in Microsoft Excel 2016 should you use to insert a new worksheet for Windows 10 operating system?

solution.content: Shift + F11.

question.content: Which of the following was the first operating system written in 'C language?

solution.content: UNIX. The C programming language came out of Bell Labs in the early 1970s by Dennis Ritchie. The C programming language was devised in the early 1970s as a system implementation language for the nascent Unix operating system.

question.content: On a computer keyboard, Shift and Alt keys are examples of:

solution.content: modifier keys. A modifier key is a key on a computer's keyboard that's only used in conjunction with another key.

question.content: Which of the following is the slowest type of internet connection?

solution.content: Dial-up. Internet connection speed in decreasing order:- Fiber - Cable - Satellite DSL - Wireless Dial-up. A dial-up connection uses a standard phone line and analog modem to access the Internet at data transfer rates (DTR) of up to 56 Kbps.

question.content: Who created FORTRAN - the first high-level computer programming language?

solution.content: John Backus Fortran (Formula Translation) is a general -purpose, compiled imperative programming language that is especially suited to numeric computation and scientific computing.

question.content: What is the keyboard shortcut to add a new row above a given row in Microsoft Excel?

solution.content: Alt + I + R. Shift + Spacebar = Select Row in Excel.

question.content: 'Nibble' in computer terminology is also called

solution.content: Nibble is also called Half byte. 1 Nibble = 4 bit.

question.content: Which company manufactured the first microprocessor 4004?

solution.content: INTEL Corporation. Examples- Intel 8085, pentium, 1486, Itanium.

question.content: The speed of the Central Processing Unit (CPU) is measured in , which represents a CPU cycle.

solution.content: Hertz (Hz). It is considered as the brain of the computer because it contains all the circuitry needed to process input, store data and output results.

question.content: In the field of computing, what does VRML stand for?

solution.content: Virtual Reality MarkUp Language (VRML) is an open-standard programming language created to design three-dimensional and Web-based models, textures and illusion. It is a modeling language.

question.content: In the field of computing, what does ENIAC stand for?

solution.content: Electronic Numerical Integrator and Computer. It was the first programmable, electronic, general -purpose digital computer.

question.content: In which year did the JavaScript Programming language come into existence?

solution.content: 1995. Objective-C, C++ (1983), Haskell (1990), Python (1991), JAVA, PHP, JavaScript (1995), Python (1991), SQL(1972), MATLAB (1978), Swift (2014).

question.content: Who designed the first analog computer in India?

solution.content: Samarendra Kumar Mitra was an Indian scientist and mathematician. He designed India's first computer in 1954 at Indian Statistical Institute, Calcutta.

question.content: Which of the following is a lever that can be moved in several directions to control the movement of an image on a computer monitor or similar display screen?

solution.content: Joystick is an input device consisting of a lever that can be moved in several directions to control the movement of an image on a computer monitor or similar display screen.

question.content: Which of the following is used to receive and send computer files over telephone lines?

solution.content: Modem (Modulator Demodulator) is a hardware component that allows a computer or another device, such as a router or switch, to connect to the Internet.

question.content: Which of the following consists of an electronic writing area and a special 'pen' that works with it?

solution.content: A graphics tablet is a computer input device that enables a user to hand-draw images, animations and graphics, with a special pen like stylus, similar to the way a person draws images with a pencil and paper.

question.content: _ is the fastest to read from and write to than the other kinds of storage in a computer.

solution.content: с) (b) Floppy Disk (d) Hard Disk RAM Access (Random Memory) is a form of computer memory that can be read and changed in any order, typically used to store working data and machine code. A random -access memory device allows data items to be read or written in almost the same amount of time irrespective of the physical location of data inside the memory.

question.content: _is a diagrammatic representation of a program logic.

solution.content: A flowchart is simply a graphical representation of steps. It shows steps in sequential order and is widely used in presenting the flow of algorithms, workflow or processes.

question.content: _ is the central server in computer network which lets the concerned user utilize the storage capacity of the server.

solution.content: file server. An application server enables a server to generate a dynamic, customized response to a client request. A print server is а dedicated appliance or central point of software.

question.content: Who Automatically (APT)? has developed the Programmable Tool

solution.content: Douglas T Ross. Automatically Programmable Tool (APT) is a program which consists of instructions/statements which are used to specify the path of the tool to follow for producing a given part.

question.content: In which of the following countries was the first Electronic Numerical Integrator and Computer, the first programmable general purpose electronic digital computer, developed?

solution.content: United States of America. Electronic Numerical Integrator and Computer (ENIAC) was invented at the University of Pennsylvania to calculate artillery firing tables for the United States Army's Ballistic Research Laboratory.

question.content: In Microsoft Office 2016, which shortcut key is used to open the Design tab?

solution.content: Alt + G. In Microsoft Office 2016 - Ctrl + K inserts a hyperlink at the text cursor's current location. Shift + F3 shortcut switches the text between uppercase, lowercase, and title case.

question.content: Which type of computers is used to control air traffic and radar of national defence?

solution.content: Hybrid computers exhibit features of analog computers and digital computers.

question.content: Who has created LISP, the Programming Language for Artificial Intelligence?

solution.content: John McCarthy. Grace Brewster Murray Hopper (1906 - 1992) - Known as "the first lady of software".
